# The `PassManagerBase` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/legacy/passmanagerbase">PassManagerBase</a> - An abstract interface to allow code to add passes to a pass manager without having to hard-code what kind of pass manager it is. <a href="#details">More...</a>

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/legacy/passmanagerbase">PassManagerBase</a> - An abstract interface to allow code to add passes to a pass manager without having to hard-code what kind of pass manager it is.

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Member Functions

### add() {#a2ce2eacfa52640d3a2feb2d46d561b85}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual void llvm::legacy::PassManagerBase::add (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pass">Pass</a> &#42; P)</>}>
Add a pass to the queue of passes to run.

This passes ownership of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pass">Pass</a> to the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/legacy/passmanager">PassManager</a>. When the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/legacy/passmanager">PassManager</a> is destroyed, the pass will be destroyed as well, so there is no need to delete the pass. This may even destroy the pass right away if it is found to be redundant. This implies that all passes MUST be allocated with &#39;new&#39;.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/legacypassmanager-h/#l00048">48</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/legacypassmanager-h">LegacyPassManager.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
